an4.7:1.1: Monks, these four types of people who are capable, educated, and self-possessed, who have studied much, memorized the teachings, and have practiced the teachings according with the teachings make the Saṅgha shine bright.
an4.7:1.3: Monks, a monk who is capable, educated, and self-possessed, who has studied much, memorized the teachings, and has practiced the teachings according with the teachings makes the Saṅgha shine bright.
an4.7:1.4: Monks, a nun who is capable, educated, and self-possessed, who has studied much, memorized the teachings, and has practiced the teachings according with the teachings makes the Saṅgha shine bright.
an4.7:1.5: Monks, a layman who is capable, educated, and self-possessed, who has studied much, memorized the teachings, and has practiced the teachings according with the teachings makes the Saṅgha shine bright.
an4.7:1.6: Monks, a laywoman who is capable, educated, and self-possessed, who has studied much, memorized the teachings, and has practiced the teachings according with the teachings makes the Saṅgha shine bright.
an4.7:1.7: Monks, these are the four types of people who are capable, educated, and self-possessed, who have studied much, memorized the teachings, and have practiced the teachings according with the teachings and make the Saṅgha shine bright.
an4.7:2.1: One who is capable and  self-possessed,
an4.7:2.2: who has studied much and has memorized the teachings,
an4.7:2.3: who practices the teaching according to the teaching,
an4.7:2.4: Such a person is said to shine bright in the Saṅgha.
an4.7:3.1: Whether a monk accomplished in virtue,
an4.7:3.2: A nun who has studied much,
an4.7:3.4: Or a laywoman who has faith,
an4.7:3.5: Yes, these make the Saṅgha shine bright!
an4.7:3.6: Surely, these shine bright in the Saṅgha!
